p: It has been reported that naringenin inhibits the inflammatory pathway involved in CAID by inhibiting NF-kB transcription activity [ 166]. Further, naringenin inhibits the inflammatory response in the respiratory tract initiated by microbial products involving pro-inflammatory cytokines, IL-1, NF-kB, and TNF-a. Naringenin inhibits the degradation of IkB that is bound to the p50/p65 subunit of NF-kB and thereby inhibits NF-kB activity [ 165, 167]. Furthermore, numerous in vivo studies have shown the therapeutic effect of naringenin in airway inflammatory diseases [ 165].
